description: The Maldives Commissioner of Police, Mohamed Hameed stated on April 20th, 2020 that legal action would be taken against those who spread false information regarding COVID-19, creating fear, and panic among the public. Legal action would be taken against those who harass or spread telltales regarding infected people.

description: Schools reopen for high school students on COVID-free islands. The Maldives government has said that it will re-open schools for students in grade nine and above in all COVID-19 free islands starting July 1.Classes for students below grade nine will continue online, while students in quarantine and isolation facilities will have special classes arranged for them.

description: The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, on 31st March, 2020, issued an order effective from 12:00pm 2nd April, 2020 that between 5:00pm and 8pm there is a curfew for suspension of all public transport services (bus and ferry).Exception to this rule are law enforcement and health providers and their vehicles, Waste Management Corporation, telecommunications, banks, stelco, and MWSC staff in uniform and on duty and their vehicles, state vehicles with 'G' license boards, diplomatic vehicles, ambulances, individuals with special pass from National Emergency Operations Centre (NEOC), individuals working in pharmacies and their vehicles, and vehicles with special stickers from the Health Protection Agency.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, on 31st March, 2020, issued an order effective from 12:00pm 2nd April, 2020 that between 5:00pm and 8pm there is a curfew enforcing stay-at-home orders restricting any and all road traffic (regarding pedestrians and vehicles).Exception to this rule are law enforcement and health providers and their vehicles, Waste Management Corporation, telecommunications, banks, stelco, and MWSC staff in uniform and on duty and their vehicles, state vehicles with 'G' license boards, diplomatic vehicles, ambulances, individuals with special pass from National Emergency Operations Centre (NEOC), individuals working in pharmacies and their vehicles, and vehicles with special stickers from the Health Protection Agency.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

The curfew will be in effect between 22:00 and 05:00 (local time).

description:
Mar. 12 --- Maldives have ,,declared its first ever state of public health emergency on Thursday, over the COVID-19 pandemic.''

,,Minister of Health Abdulla Ameen stated that the emergency, declared under Section 33 of the 7/2012 Public Health Act, would be in effect from March 12 onwards for a period of 30 days.''
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
On March 12, 2020 the Maldives Minister of Health, Abdulla Ameen declared a state of public health emergency in Maldives, for a 30-day long period. 

The state of emergency has been extended six times and has now been extended to September 6th, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mohamed Aslam, the acting Minister of Health, on October 6,2020  extended the State of Public Health Emergency, declared in Maldives due to the COVID-19 pandemic, until November 5.

description: Maldives authorities announced that entry banned for travelers from China. The Maldives government, on 3 February 2020, adopted additional border control measures as a Novel Coronavirus safeguard, restricting entry to all passengers, regardless of nationality except for Maldivian citizens who have China as their port of embarkation or have transited through Mainland China in the last 14 days before their departure.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Total border crossing ban

description: As of October 15 2020 in Maldives, all tourists and short-term visitors into the Maldives are required to provide a negative COVID-19 test result upon arrival taken no more than 96 hours prior to arriving. Authorities approved the reopening of some guesthouses on October 15 for tourists; foreign travelers must reserve accommodations at either one or a maximum of two different approved resorts. Travelers must stay in these locations for the entirety of their trips, unless visiting approved dining facilities and recreational venues. Travelers entering the country will not be required to quarantine but must complete an online health declaration via the Imuga portal within 24 hours of travel.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Negative COVID-19 Test
target_geog_level: All countries

description: As of October 31 2020 in Maldives under the current circumstances, the tourist must stay at the resort establishment booked prior to their arrival. Travel to other islands or to the capital, Male’ City is not permitted.The Traveler Health Declaration (THD) must be filled in and submitted by all visitors twice – 24 hours before your flight to the Maldives and once more before you depart from the Maldives.It is mandatory requirement for all tourists to present a Negative result for a nucleic acid test (PCR test) for Covid-19 on arrival effective 10th September 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih of Maldives, announced during a cabinet meeting on April 13th, 2020 that a "National Taskforce on Resilience Building and Economic Recovery" would be created  to prepare for the eventual lifting of the 'State of Public Health Emergency' imposed in response to the ongoing global COVID-19 pandemic
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: Mar. 12 --- ,,The Maldives government says it has built the world's first coronavirus resort to quarantine patients on an island called Villivaru in the Kaafu Atoll, about 24km (15 miles) north of Malé, the capital city. ''
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_text: The Maldives government says it has built the world's first coronavirus resort to quarantine patients on an island called Villivaru in the Kaafu Atoll, about 24km (15 miles) north of Malé, the capital city.

description: As of March 14, 2020 , as per protocol Maldivian national who arrived in Maldives from Bangladesh, is being placed under 14-day quarantine
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of March 18 2020 a mandatory 14-day quarantine for entering travelers. Maldivians arriving from other countries will be kept under 14 days home quarantine. Violating the formal notice on quarantine   isolation under the Public Health Act will be fined up to MVR 5000.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, on May 2nd, 2020 issued a notice for the quarantining of  migrant workers living in the greater Male area  (Male', Vilimale, and Hulhumale'), in a place designated by the National Emergency Operation Centre (NEOC).The migrant workers include those who don't have specified work places or designated living quarters, those who are presently living in residences monitored by the Maldives Police Service who have exposure to large numbers of people who have contracted Covid-19, those who have been in direct or indirect contact and have a risk of contracting Covid-19, and those who are not included in the above categories but are at risk of contracting Covid-19.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units (other than provincial or city level units) within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Migrant workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable)

description: The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, issued a notice for all guesthouses and city hotels operating in Maldives to suspend all tourist check-ins, effective from March 31, 2020, 6:00 pm.Tourists who have already checked in shall be allowed to stay for the duration of their booking.

description:
The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, on 31st March, 2020, issued an order effective from 12:00pm 2nd April, 2020 that outside of the hours between 5:00pm and 8pm congregations of more that three people are not allowed in public.

Exception to this rule are law enforcement and health providers and their vehicles, Waste Management Corporation, telecommunications, banks, stelco, and MWSC staff in uniform and on duty and their vehicles, state vehicles with 'G' license boards, diplomatic vehicles, ambulances, individuals with special pass from National Emergency Operations Centre (NEOC), individuals working in pharmacies and their vehicles, and vehicles with special stickers from the Health Protection Agency.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
